title: Sonia Kruger puts on a brave face amid Today Extra axing rumours
text:
Over the weekend, The Sunday Telegraph reported that Sonia Kruger was set to be 'replaced' by Georgie Gardner on Channel Nine's Today Extra.

But the 54-year-old presenter hasn't let the claims, which Nine executives have dismissed as false and 'shameful', dampen her spirits.

Sonia smiled for photographers as she strolled through Sydney Airport on Monday, putting on a brave face despite the speculation about her career.

All smiles! Sonia Kruger smiled for photographers as she strolled through Sydney Airport on Monday, putting on a brave face despite recent speculation about her career at Channel Nine

Sonia looked glowing in a black mini dress, which she paired with a black and white striped cardigan.

She completed her look with slides and oversized sunglasses as she scrolled through her iPhone.

It comes after The Sunday Telegraph alleged that Georgie may be 'shunted' from Today and relegated to Today Extra in a staff shake-up next year.

Stylish: Sonia, 54, wore a black mini dress and striped cardigan, and accessorised with slides and oversized sunglasses

Fabrication: Over the weekend, The Sunday Telegraph reported that Sonia was set to be 'replaced' by Georgie Gardner (pictured) on Channel Nine's Today Extra

Georgie's proposed 'demotion' to Today Extra would mean that Sonia would likely have to step aside, unless Nine planned to break from tradition and have three hosts.

But a network spokesperson strongly denied the Telegraph's report in a statement to Daily Mail Australia.

'All of the talk is made up,' they said. 'The sustained attack by The Sunday Telegraph on the female presenters of Nine is aimed to damage the standing of some of Australia's most talented women in the media.

'Working mums Georgie Gardner, Erin Molan, Sonia Kruger and Deborah Knight are just some of the Nine women who are performing great roles across the various parts of the business, yet have been targeted by The Sunday Telegraph in a shameful onslaught of stories.'

Fake news: A Nine spokesperson strongly denied the Telegraph's report, telling Daily Mail Australia it was a total fabrication. Pictured: Sonia and her Today Extra co-host David Campbell

The Sunday Telegraph claimed that Sonia would likely be a 'casualty' in the network's proposed reshuffle, but Nine has denied this will happen.

Sonia, who also hosts The Voice, signed with Nine in 2011 after her departure from Seven. She has been an anchor on Today Extra since its launch in 2012 as Mornings.

Last week, it was reported that comedian Andy Lee had allegedly been approached by Nine bosses 'to have a crack at co-hosting the Today show'.

authors: David Wu For Daily Mail Australia
